text: Sergei Adamovich Kovalyov (also spelled Sergey Kovalev; ; 2 March 1930 â€“ 9 August 2021) was a Russian human rights activist and politician. He was a dissident and political prisoner in the Soviet era. He was a critic of Vladimir Putin and his government. From 1993 until 2003, Kovalev was a member of the State Duma. Kovalev was born in Seredyna-Buda, Soviet Union. Kovalev died on 9 August 2021 in Moscow, aged 91."Sergei Kovalyov, Heir to Sakharov who always put Principles first, Dies At 91", Radio Free Europe (9 August 2021) ==References== ==Other websites== * Kovalyov at Amnesty International * Putin critic loses post, platform for inquiry * Kovalyov is one of recipients of 1995 Democracy Award at National Endowment for Democracy Category:1930 births Category:2021 deaths Category:Members of the State Duma Category:Russian writers Category:Russian human rights activists Category:Soviet dissidents Category:People from Sumy Oblast
